name: Squishy the Suicidal Pig
description: From the creators of Hero Siege, Squishy the Suicidal Pig is a puzzle platformer with a counterintuitive goal where you play as Squishy, a pig wearing a yellow sweater who's trying to reach his parents in animal heaven by completing his deal with the devil.You asked for a challenge, now you have it!
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows 7 or Windows 8 Processor: 1.8 GHZ Memory: 1 MB RAM Graphics: 128 mb Storage: 80 MB available space

reviews.review_text: Game costs 14 cents, cards are worth 24 cents.  Game of the year 2015.  EDIT: Squishy is no longer on sale, but it's definitely worth the price. It's a pretty neat little platformer, but quite difficult in some parts.
Pretty tough game. achievments are hard, you will die constantly (while trying to die 'properly').  However is quite entertaining.   Would recommend, well worth it for its cheap price.

I mean this game is good, BUT theres too many bugs that ain't getting any fixes, so i don't see any reason to recommend this game. The bugs have been there for a lot of time now and still have not been fixed. It is indeed still a fun time wasteing game.

It could be a good game, but it's not for several reasons. 1) Weak and boring plot. 2) Buggy achievements. Read steam discussion threads for more information. 3) Buggy mechanics. You don't see it in the beginning, but the more you play, the more it becomes noticeable. 4) Poorly balanced boss battles. Insane difficulty (it's the hardest one) requires extremely fast reaction, but even if you are good enough, you can lose due to bad luck or buggy mechanics.  Who knows, maybe in the future developers will fix all bugs of this game, but right now I don't recommend to buy this game.
Bought it for 0,14 € sold the cards for a total of 0,16€.   Would do again :)
This game is frickin' incredible....it has the fastest card drops of any game that I've ever seen!!  10/10

Yep. It's true. A Wolf in Sheeps clothing. Squishy is a good game.  Once the intro is done shocking you, and you go OOOOOOOOOOOOOOH!!! You are dropped into a very capable Puzzle Platforming game. I've had fun with it.  Notes. This is not a kiddy game. You WILL need to think. You WILL fail. You WILL have to restart levels often, to try again.

10/10 This is a great puzzle platformer game where you find yourself trying to kill yourself. There are many different ways to kill yourself, such as jumping out of the screen, jumping into spikes, jumping into axes, getting blown up by TNT or nitro blocks, having a block drop on your head, and even getting hit by a spikey ball. These kind of levels are usually the puzzle kind of levels. There are also some levels where you have to not die and dodge every obstacle that comes your way. These kinds of levels are the platformer kind of levels. I haven't seen a game like this since Mr. Karoshi, a game that came out on the IOS many years ago. This is a great game that is very unique and fun to play. There are four worlds with about 10 levels in each world, so you almost never get bored! There are also minigames, such as battle, which is multiplayer, and survival, where you try to dodge obstacles and survive as long as you can. Great game.

This Game is very addicting and once you buy it, you'll never stop playing it! Some levels are hard and others are not! The pig is a Suicide victim..... Thats all I'm going to tell you! I hope you all have as much fun as I am :D
awesome concept and just the right blend of difficulty for a platformer. I tried the insane mode and i wanted to rip my hands off. AWESOME GAME, especially for 14 ceents.

Don't buy this game. NEVER buy this game. The only reason i have it is because it was 14 cents. And I still don't think it's worth it. This game is just a simple puzzle game, and if it was free, it wouldn't be that bad. But because you are required to pay for it, that just makes me angry, when there are games almost exatly like this (if not better) that are FREE, and you have to pay 2 dollars (at the moment 14 cents) for this, makes it bad. So, i'll say it again. DO. NOT. BUY. THIS. GAME.  ok, i think i'll actually review it now. So, this game, like I said, is a puzzle-platformer were the goal is to kill yourself each time. while the goal is unique, the gameplay isn't, basicly you push blocks around and blow up other boxes, whle activating fans to get through the level. only problem is, the game isn't direct, and, if you're like me, your gonna screw up a lot, which is very fustrating. i didn't have fun playing it, and like with most puzzle platformers (FREE ONES) i got bored, but i PAID for this, so i feel very let down. I'm sure that it gets somewhat better as you go along, but don't even bother, just go to armorgames and pick a game from there and save your money. So, there you have it, dont buy this game for full price, and if you REALLY want it, pick it up now and sell the trading cards that you get so you get your money back. But, i still think thats a bad idea. Just keep your money, and play a free game, instead of one that should be free.

This has to be the dullest game I have ever played, with no satisying consequences. Watch as your character waddles at 0.5 miles an hour, as he slowly moves across the level in a literal attempt to kill yourself. The gameplay is essentially your character slowly moving across the level, moving boxes, activating levers and triggering explosions. With the main objective being your own death, you'd expect at least some funny and satisfying death animations. But no, it's just another splatter of blood from a falling crate or stabbing from spikes, with the word 'DEAD' flashing on your screen for about fifteen seconds before the game slowly transitions to the level selestion screen. An absolute waste of time and money, with extreme boredom as the main gameplay. Want to spend money still? Don't buy this game, and spend the cash on a hat on Team Fortress 2. At least then you would've bought something you'd enjoy.

For most of the game it is fun, it makes you think outside the box, and makes you feel like a retard and makes you think 'why the hell didn't i think of that?!'...But when it's time to fight a boss...♥♥♥♥ that, you get to pick a dificulty ,ok cool, that's normal,but it doesn't make the bosses harder to beat with better AI...No , it just becomes ♥♥♥♥ing unfair, good luck beating bosses without having rage on insane difficulty,even though I'm giving a positive review the boss part takes a huge chunk out of the final score, my final score is I'd say about 6,it's still worth buying, it is a fun game Edit 1: I didn't want to be the guy that gives a bad review because he can't play the game, but you know what? f uck it...When a game makes the only way to win a boss battle is to have COMPLETE LUCK where some f ucking boxes fall from the sky,when you put boxes falling at least give them space between them so the player CAN F UCKING FIT , you could say I'm being harsh...no,when 8 boxes fall from right to left in a row and you're on the midle of them, you are f ucked , as simple as that, you know you ♥♥♥♥ed up as a programmer and as a designer when that happens...Current score 3/10

Okay, so after playing through the first world and most of the second I've come to the conclusion that this game has a lot of artificial difficulty going for it.  Now please hear me out before the inevitable before you start throwing “git gud” comments at me. I completed Super Hexagon, Super Meat Boy, 1001 Spikes etc. So I do feel somewhat qualified to point out these supposedly “flaws” as the average gamer I am.  Most of the bosses are pretty much purely RNG based with a very low amount of positioning yourself out of danger's way. Too often i find myself in situations where death simply was unavoidable. It happens so frequently that it makes me wonder if that was supposed to be this game's gimmick?  Now, I’m not strictly talking about the Insane bosses I would also like to point out the at times unresponsive controls which lead me to fall into a pit or to leap over a platform because the moving platform I jumped from gave me too much momentum. This can get very frustrating and random obstacles like the sand pits in level 2-8 with no apparent purpose suddenly starts to make sense, they were put there to make backtracking take even longer and the player’s experience so much worse at other times it is the weird level design that gets me (yes I’m looking at you level 2-4 with awkward jump you had to make which apparently is “skill based”) or subtle hints like “Gur nafjre vf sbhe naq fvk” which I’m sure has a logical explanation to it that I’m just too stupid to translate, only problem is that the text disappears after 5 seconds and no, there’s no way for you to go up to the sign and read what it said again as it would in any normal game, you have to exit the level to read it again.  All this is disregarding the various bugs like when I had to exit a level and “Restart and “Exit” did literally the same, forcing me to either complete the level or close the game or getting pushed into a block so that I couldn’t move and had to restart.  Final words: I’ve tried my best to make this review as objective as I could but would I recommend this to anyone else? Definitely not! Where does this game shine? I think the idea of having to lose your life is a neat idea that I’m pretty fond of, it’s what hooked me in the beginning but I’m afraid that’s all...not even the music which I know is subjective is very repetitive to me.
Speedrun is an hour long but its a great puzzle indie game. Got it for 0.14 cents!

IT'S A TRAP!  ...I guess my good friend Han knew that, as he repeatedly rejected Squishy the Suicidal Pig as a gift ;( On the bright side, this is a hell of a good card to play in video game hangman. The rest of the Calamari were dumfounded!  Overall: 10/10 for banter 1/10 for gameplay...but who cares about that ♥♥♥♥?

The jumping is hit or miss. Pushing the jump button does not reliably result in a jump. The jumping is also not controllable. You jump the same amount if you tap jump as you do if you hold jump. The colision detection is sketchy as hell. You never know if you're fall off the edge of something or not. Projectiles do not follow a ballistic arc which makes dodging things (or getting hit intentionally) very hard for anybody who has experience with gravity. These problems result in platforming that is mediocre at best and enraging at worst.  The puzzle aspect was good at first, but that is quickly replaced with 'not puzzles'. The main 'not puzzles' are the poorly executed platforming described above, and levels that require you to go through them several times to memorize ♥♥♥♥ (the thing a hate most in gaming).  If you want a puzzle game, get something by Zachtronics. If you want a difficult platformer, get one of the hacked Mario roms. The point is that a huge selection of much better games exist for both genres and the combination.

Gameplay is all side-scrolling platformer in where you kill yourself in various ways. Music is all Crash Bandicoot style. Ironically happy when your character is constantly in a state of panic. Price is A-OK. I got it for 14 cents though. Call me stingy. This game has made me realize something... COMEDY is easy. DYING is very very hard.

WARNING: THIS GAME MAY CAUSE MILD INFURIATION AND INSPIRE AN URGE TO REACH INTO THE GAME AND STRANGLE SQUISHY YOURSELF.  As you can tell, this game is extremely annoying at times, not entirely because of the time sensitive platforming and complex puzzles, but because the developers thought it would be funny to add dumb ways to change how the player thinks about the game in order to keep them stuck on a level until they look up the solution to it online. Other than this, the game is pretty inventive and challenging when it comes to solving puzzles that make sense within the 'rules' of the game.  Pros: Interesting, dark take on a typical platformer Lengthy and challenging gameplay Fluid movement and responsive controls (sometimes to a fault) Profitable due to cheap sale price and card value  Cons: Occasional very stupid solutions to levels Frustrating lack of USEFUL in-game tips, especially when new game features are introduced Consistent need to reset the level because of one accidental movement  Overall:  8/10  Simply buy it on sale, play through the first world or so, and sell cards to profit.

They told me to kill myself.  So I did, and I've been doing it for hours. Through thought-provoking, mind-boggling riddles I have unlocked the true meaning of Squishy the Suicidal Pig. It's not just a game about a pig who needs to kill himself to be reunited with his family, it's a direct message to the player who assumes his role. My mother told me that her patrilineal side contains an ancestor who embarked on the famous Mayflower, that which the known pilgrims took to the Americas. I've always wanted to see for myself, and so lately I've wondered if I could kill myself and meet him.  Just like Squishy, I forgot. I forgot that suicide is a sin, and that doing so would place me in hell. But, in the game, Squishy is given a chance to redeem himself, to challenge Satan and rejoin his mother and father. If Squishy can do it, we can do it. Want to meet an ancient ancestor in the afterlife? Kill yourself. And if you pass the trials, you'll be granted infinite knowledge.  Kys
this game is the perfect game to take your anger out on a pig

I hate this game. The puzzles were fun but I hate it. The practically non-existent physics, the random but not rare at all 'f*ck you' scenarios that make a stage unbeatable until you restart, they make it a bad game.  Why the positive review though? Me and my boyfriend had a great time watching each other play and suffer. The empathy towards the end was an awesome bonding experience.   No seriously. You will curse a lot, but when you get something done, you'll feel great. Once you've tilted so much that you are done with life, you will feel calmer than ever. Can't really describe it. For heaven's sake (heh), try it yourself. It's so cheap when on sale, the steam cards alone are worth the price.

I got this game for cheap and it kinda feels like it. For awhile I was having fun, until i came to the Coyote (or dingo, whatever) boss fight. He's the second boss battle in the game and i found him to be incredibly difficult. Of the 4.3 hours i have clocked in on this game i've spent half of them trying to beat this ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥. Even when I discovered two glitches and exploited the crap out of them I couldn't beat him. Sometimes he'll glitch and throw the item you need to kill him out of reach! On top of that some of the levels you can actually 'cheat' at just by walking left. Its just a game that becomes less and less fun as you play it before you're completely stopped by a brick wall.
You are a sad pig who wants to die. 11/10

This game is really enjoyable to play so far.

Hello people of the world, this game is awesome. It is an extremely emotional game in which you can relate to the protagonist more than you have ever related to anyone. How you ask? It'll make you want to commit suicide at points, just like this pig. It gives you these suicidal thoughts because of the fact that if you push a box or blow something up or die... You have to start the level over.  However, the dying part brings me to my next point. In a game where you're supposed to die to advance, I have found that in at least one level, if you die, you lose, which in my opinion, contradicts with the point of the game.   Overall, this game is completely worth the money and y'all should buy it now. Thank you for your time, bye.
